intro: Andersonglossum occidentale, commonly known as the western pearly meadowblower, is a flowering plant native to western North America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and prairies, often in areas with well-drained soil. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem, while its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer. The species is noted for its ecological importance, providing nectar for pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
